dylanGenericFunction.shortdesc: Returns the comparison of two strings for equality, ignoring case differences between them.

apiDesc.p: Compares string1 and string2 for equality, ignoring any case differences between them. Returns true if they are equal, and false otherwise.

The function has the same behavior as Dylanâ€™s standard method on = for sequences, except that when comparing alphabetical characters, it ignores any case differences. This function is used as an equivalence predicate for case-insensitive-string-hash.
This function uses as-uppercase or as-lowercase to convert the characters in its string arguments.

COMMENT: AndrewS 1997-05-09: MarkT says: There is no discussion of whether case-insensitive-equal is defined on <unicode-string> or merely on <byte-string>, and if <unicode-string>, what its semantics are for non-Latin char. sets
Kevin Mitchell says: "It uses as-lowercase or as-uppercase to convert the characters in the strings. UNICODE semantics are whatever they are for those functions."
